description: Technical Development and Support Services for the Department of Indigenous Services Canada (ISC).
full_summary:
#### Technical Development and Support Services for Indigenous Services Canada

**Notice Title:** Technical Development and Support Services for Indigenous Services Canada (ISC).

**Background:** 
Indigenous Services Canada (ISC) and Crown Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs Canada (CIRNAC) are responsible for meeting the federal government’s constitutional, treaty, and legal obligations to Aboriginal Peoples. Under this mandate, ISC/CIRNAC ensures the delivery of various programs and services to Aboriginal Communities. The Enterprise IT Infrastructure Services Directorate (EIIS) of the Information Management Branch (IMB) supports the departments' IT infrastructure. EIIS aims to provide a secure, stable, and efficient IT infrastructure to meet these responsibilities.

**Objective:** 
ISC/CIRNAC seeks a service provider to provide technical development and support services to EIIS operational activities and projects. The service provider shall assist with the development and implementation of desktop environments and cloud services. The services will support EIIS’s delivery of various programs and services to Aboriginal Communities.

**Scope of Work:**

*   Reviewing and documenting existing IT architecture and management systems.
*   Providing technical support for desktop and cloud services.
*   Developing project plans for the development, testing, and implementation of desktop images and cloud-based technologies and configurations.
*   Conducting testing and quality assurance to ensure the satisfactory completion of projects.
*   Providing project management services, including resource allocation and accounting.
*   Performing other related technical development and support services, as required by ISC/CIRNAC.

**Duration:** 
The contract is expected to begin in March 2023 and run for approximately five years, until March 2028.

**Evaluation Criteria:**

*   Technical capability and expertise in providing the required services.
*   Past experience in delivering similar services to the Government of Canada.
*   Price and value of services.

**How to Respond:**
Indigenous Services Canada invites qualified service providers to submit a proposal for the provision of technical development and support services to EIIS. The proposal shall include a detailed description of the services proposed, as well as relevant examples of past work and supporting documentation.

**Response Instructions:**

1.  Review the accompanying RFP Package and ensure that all services proposed are aligned with ISC’s requirements.
2.  Follow the instructions provided for completing the Fields Required for Electronic Response (FCER) format.
3.  Ensure that the proposal is submitted in electronic format only. 

**Contact:**
Bruno Paradis, Project Manager
Indigenous Services Canada
CIHR Building, 10 Wellington St.
